reviews.title: Reasonably priced, luxurious setting
reviews.text: Breakfast, lunch or dinner... the food is reasonably priced and better than most restaurants in Merida. There is almost always a crowd for dinner, which is a testament to the food, atmosphere and service. Rosas + Xocolate is really the nicest place to eat dinner within walking distance of the Centro...perfect for a special occasion.

Tonight, we went to R y X for a light dinner. It was a beautiful warm winter night, so we asked to be seated in the courtyard. A few minutes after our wine was poured, a photo shoot, complete with art director, lighting equipment, etc. showed up to photograph a young lady wearing a hideous white evening gown. Pretty much ruined a nice meal out. In fact, I’m still seeing blue dots from the flashes in my face. At mid-meal, we asked to be moved inside. Seems like every time we go to Rosas y Xocolate, something funky happens—yet we still go back…
reviews.title: Inconsistent
Great Wine, Beautiful Decor, Food--so, so.
reviews.text: This restaurant is absolutely beautiful. In terms of atmosphere, it could compare with any great restaurant in New York. There is a substantial wine list that has some great bottles, something that is not so common in Mexico. The food was inconsistent. I got a rib eye, which was very good, but the duck appetizer was tough and unappetizing. The fried octopus was delicious, but the shrimp app with a tomato and chile sauce was very salty. The arugula and pear salad was great, the seafood pasta was ordinary. Ek Chuah offers a fun night out in Mérida, and some of the dishes are great, but I would recommend sticking to the simple items on the menu--this is not a restaurant that excels at innovative cuisine.

reviews.title: beautiful restaurant, but expensive
reviews.text: We ate at this restaurant our last night in Merida. The restaurant atmosphere is really charming, but the food was average and quite expensive. I would not return next trip.

reviews.title: Very elegant restaurant
reviews.text: I just got back from Merida. My daughter wanted to try this restaurant based on the reviews. We were not disappointed. We went there for lunch and I had the salmon and she had the beef. We were also served homemade breads which were delicious. The meals had excellent presentations and we were very impressed. The owner just happened to be there and he came over to our table and we had a nice conversation with us. He also left word at the hotel side to have the staff give us a tour of the hotel. It is also very beautiful and very well designed. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone.

reviews.title: Food decent, bar great!
reviews.text: I found the food at the restaurant to be decent. We only ate in merida one night, and this was our choice. I got the filet in oregano, and my beef was amazing, but I found the herbs to be a bit too much flavor for me. My husband loved the pork rack. I'm a picky eater.

We visited several times during our holiday because it really was excellent. A creative menu executed to a very high-standard, a good wine list, cold cold cocktails, a buzzy atmosphere, friendly staff. What more can you ask for?
reviews.title: By far our favourite restaurant in Merida, would grace any major city

reviews.text: In fact we liked it so much we booked a room in the hotel for our last night in Mexico. That was excellent too!
reviews.title: Great atmosphere and Food

reviews.text: Went here on a date night with the lady and another couple. We all really enjoyed our food and thought the price was right. If you're looking for a place with very good food and a nice atmosphere, this is a place worth visiting.
reviews.title: Superbly creative!

reviews.text: A marvelous dining experience, both for lunch and dinner, owned and operated by a very exacting and interesting individual, Carol Kolozs.
reviews.title: Hands down our favorite restaurant in Merida

reviews.text: We enjoyed a wide variety of dining experiences in Merida from very local taco establishments to Rosas Y Xocoalte. All very excellent in their own right, with Rosas at the top of our list for exquisite dining!
reviews.title: Good food but...
our favorite in merida
reviews.text: we live in nyc but have a house in merida. it is the best restaurant in the centro...everything we have had is really good and beautifully presented!!! we are so happy it has opened, it is definitely a great addition to merida!!!!!

reviews.title: Had agurala salad With pear n goat cheese...
reviews.text: Had agurala salad With pear n goat cheese and it was so good! Presentation was elegant but tasted even better n sophisticated. For main entree I tried salmon recommended by the Waiter (who translated half the menu nicely but I was so hungry I just asked him recommend instead.) it was pretty good only a bit salty for my taste buds). They offered three kinds of bread n all were good.

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.text: Four of us had an amazing meal at Rosas Y Xocolate last night. I live in San Francisco, so I know good food, and this was on par with the best meals I have eaten in SF.

reviews.title: Must go in Merida
reviews.text: For appetizers, the Carpaccio was great, as well as the Pulpo Chiccarones (fried Octopus). Entrees of Salmon with a Chaya Goat Cheese sauce, rack of lamb, and Ahi with curry sauce were remarkable. And dessert was really good too.

reviews.title: Excellent Food and Atmosphere
reviews.text: The ambiance and service were great too. We're going to try to go back in the next couple days before we leave.
